definition: lit. the cycle comes back to the start (idiom); to move in circles/the wheel comes full circle
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: The process never ends; it constantly moves back upon itself to go forward.
sentences.chinese: 这过程永无止尽，总是周而复始的继续向前。

sentences.english: It follows this loop over and over again until it is turned off.
sentences.chinese: 它周而复始地执行这些循环，直到被关闭为止。

sentences.english: There are repeated scares and usually it's all right.
sentences.chinese: 经济危机周而复始但最后总是会结束。

sentences.english: Only the cycle of changes could display spectacular scene.
sentences.chinese: 只有周而复始的变动才会焕发出万千的气象。

sentences.english: It was my start to the day, every day.
sentences.chinese: 这是我一天的开始，周而复始。

sentences.english: But there is no choice but to go on.
sentences.chinese: 但除了周而复始，就别无选择。

sentences.english: Labile cells follow the cell cycle from one mitosis to the next.
sentences.chinese: 不稳定细胞循细胞周期周而复始地进行有丝分裂。

definition: to go and come back/to make a return trip/backwards and forwards (e.g. of piston or pump action)/to reciprocate (of machine part)
lit. the end comes back to the start (idiom); the wheel comes full circle
to grow and multiply without end
variant of 重複|重复[chong2 fu4]
to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 輪迴|轮回[lun2 hui2]
